description: This specification defines various APIs for programmatic access to HTML and generic XML parsers by web applications for use in parsing and serializing DOM nodes.
title: DOM Parsing and Serialization

description: This document defines a way to include and reuse HTML documents in other HTML documents.
title: HTML Imports

description: This specification defines the 5th major version, third minor revision of the core language of the World Wide Web: the Hypertext Markup Language (HTML). In this version, new features continue to be introduced to help Web application authors, new elements continue to be introduced based on research into prevailing authoring practices, and special attention continues to be given to defining clear conformance criteria for user agents in an effort to improve interoperability.
title: HTML 5.3

description: This specification defines the microdata syntax, which extends HTML to allow embedding of unambiguous machine-readable data. Microdata is similar in approach to RDFa, and can be written in a style which is convertible to RDF, but does not automatically use the RDF data model.
title: HTML Microdata

description: This specification defines the values for the KeyboardEvent.code attribute which is defined in DOM 3 Events.
title: UI Events KeyboardEvent code Values

description: This specification defines the values for the KeyboardEvent.key attribute which is defined in DOM 3 Events.
title: UI Events KeyboardEvent key Values

description: This document is a practical guide for developers on how to add accessibility information to HTML elements using ARIA, a markup mechanism for making Web content and Web applications more accessible to people with disabilities.
title: Using ARIA

versions.title: Notes on Using ARIA in HTML
Notes on Using ARIA in HTML
Notes on Using ARIA in HTML
